senses.sense_definition: A small, magical creature similar to a fairy, often depicted in folklore as mischievous or playful, and in modern culture as a helper to Santa Claus.

examples.text: The children were excited to see the <w>elf</w> sitting on the shelf.
According to the story, a helpful <w>elf</w> finished the work while the shoemaker slept.

senses.sense_definition: A member of a magical race of beings who appear human-like but are typically taller, more graceful, and immortal, often characterized by pointed ears.

examples.text: The <w>elf</w> moved silently through the forest, his bow ready for any danger.
In the movie, the <w>elf</w> spoke an ancient language that no one else understood.

senses.sense_definition: A supernatural spirit from mythology, often associated with nature, mischief, or causing illness.

examples.text: Old legends warn travelers about a mischievous <w>elf</w> that leads people astray in the woods.
The villagers believed an <w>elf</w> was responsible for the sudden sickness of their cattle.

senses.sense_definition: Acronym for English as a Lingua Franca, referring to the use of the English language as a common means of communication between speakers of different native languages.

examples.text: Many international corporations rely on <w>ELF</w> for daily communication between employees from different countries.
The professor published a paper on the grammatical features of <w>ELF</w> in Europe.

senses.sense_definition: Initialism of Earth Liberation Front, a radical environmentalism group known for direct action.

examples.text: The <w>ELF</w> claimed responsibility for the protest that took place at the logging site.
Authorities investigated the <w>ELF</w> after the incident at the ski resort.
